intro: Relbunium hypocarpium var. viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered relbunium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, lanceolate leaves with a distinctive silvery underside. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
